newsitem.title: GREECE: AGRICULTURAL BANK/GREECE SAYS 96 PROFITS DOWN 19PCT.
newsitem.headline: AGRICULTURAL BANK/GREECE SAYS 96 PROFITS DOWN 19PCT.

text.p: State Agriculture Bank of Greece posted profits of 13.3 billion drachmas in 1996, down from 15.8 billion in 1995, its chairman Christos Papathanasiou told reporters.
Lower lending rates and higher operating costs were to be blamed for the decrease in profits, said Papathanasiou.
Lending rose 7.3 percent in 1996, deposits grew 10.3 percent and equity capital by 10.3 percent due to an increase in reserves, he added.

Agricultural Bank will set up a management firm to coordinate the activities of companies belonging to its group and expects to choose an advisor to assist it in restructuring its group in June, said Papathanasiou.
